name: ListOnCallSchedules
description:
Retrieve a list of on-call schedules.

Use this tool to obtain details about on-call schedules, including which users are on-call and their corresponding time periods. Useful for managing team availability and coverage.

parameters.name: accept_header_version
parameters.description: The `Accept` header specifying desired API versioning. Use it to ensure version compatibility.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the format of the data being sent. Use 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of results to return per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results. Useful for navigating through a large list of schedules.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: filter_by_schedule_name
parameters.description: Filters the results to show only schedules whose name matches the provided query string.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

parameters.name: additional_details_to_include
parameters.description: Specify details like 'schedule_layers', 'overrides_subschedule', or 'final_schedule' to include in the response.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: results_display_time_zone
parameters.description: Time zone in which results will be presented. Defaults to the current user's or account's time zone.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the current user's time zone and then the account's time zone.

parameters.name: user_id_for_next_oncall
parameters.description: Specify a user ID to retrieve the user's next on-call information.

value_schema.description: Specify an `user_id`, and the schedule list API will return information about this user's next on-call.

parameters.name: start_date_range
parameters.description: The start date for the schedule entries view. Defaults to two weeks before 'until' if provided.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks before until if an until is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

parameters.name: end_date_range
parameters.description: The end date for schedule entries display. Defaults to 2 weeks after the start if not specified.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks after since if a since is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

parameters.name: populate_total_field
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the total field in pagination responses, providing the total number of entries.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional details to include.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the current user's time zone and then the account's time zone.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the current user's time zone and then the account's time zone.

parameters.name: include_next_oncall_for_user
parameters.description: Specify an `user_id`, and the schedule list API will return information about this user's next on-call.

value_schema.description: Specify an `user_id`, and the schedule list API will return information about this user's next on-call.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks before until if an until is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks before until if an until is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The end of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks after since if a since is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to show schedule entries. Defaults to 2 weeks after since if a since is given. Optional parameter. When provided with include[] for schedule types, populates the rendered_schedule_entries fields in the response.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
